annotations.description:
Jenkins service, with persistent storage.

NOTE: You must have persistent volumes available in your cluster to use this template.
annotations.openshift.io/long-description: This template deploys a Jenkins server capable of managing OpenShift Pipeline builds and supporting OpenShift-based oauth login.

message: A Jenkins service has been created in your project.  Log into Jenkins with your OpenShift account.  The tutorial at https://github.com/openshift/origin/blob/master/examples/jenkins/README.md contains more information about using this template.

parameters.name: JENKINS_SERVICE_NAME
parameters.description: The name of the OpenShift Service exposed for the Jenkins container.

parameters.name: JNLP_SERVICE_NAME
parameters.description: The name of the service used for master/slave communication.

parameters.name: ENABLE_OAUTH
parameters.description: Whether to enable OAuth OpenShift integration. If false, the static account 'admin' will be initialized with the password 'password'.

parameters.name: MEMORY_LIMIT
parameters.description: Maximum amount of memory the container can use.

parameters.name: VOLUME_CAPACITY
parameters.description: Volume space available for data, e.g. 512Mi, 2Gi.

parameters.name: NAMESPACE
parameters.description: The OpenShift Namespace where the Jenkins ImageStream resides.

parameters.name: DISABLE_ADMINISTRATIVE_MONITORS
parameters.description: Whether to perform memory intensive, possibly slow, synchronization with the Jenkins Update Center on start.  If true, the Jenkins core update monitor and site warnings monitor are disabled.

parameters.name: JAVA_FIPS_OPTIONS
parameters.displayName: Allows control over how the JVM interacts with FIPS on startup.
parameters.description: See https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/openjdk/11/html-single/configuring_openjdk_11_on_rhel_with_fips/index#config-fips-in-openjdk for the available command line properties to facilitate the JVM running on FIPS nodes.

parameters.name: JENKINS_IMAGE_STREAM_TAG
parameters.description: Name of the ImageStreamTag to be used for the Jenkins image.

parameters.name: ENABLE_FATAL_ERROR_LOG_FILE
parameters.description: When a fatal error occurs, an error log is created with information and the state obtained at the time of the fatal error.

parameters.name: JENKINS_UC_INSECURE
parameters.displayName: Allows use of Jenkins Update Center repository with invalid SSL certificate
parameters.description: Whether to allow use of a Jenkins Update Center that uses invalid certificate (self-signed, unknown CA). If any value other than 'false', certificate check is bypassed. By default, certificate check is enforced.

parameters.name: AGENT_BASE_IMAGE
parameters.displayName: Image used for the 'jnlp' container of the sample 'java-sidecar' and 'nodejs-sidecar' PodTemplates
parameters.description: Setting this value overrides the image used for the 'jnlp' container in the sample kubernetes plug-in PodTemplates provided with this image.  Otherwise, the image from the 'jenkins-agent-base:latest' ImageStreamTag in the 'openshift' namespace is used.

parameters.name: JAVA_BUILDER_IMAGE
parameters.displayName: Image used for the 'java' container of the sample 'java-builder' PodTemplate
parameters.description: Setting this value overrides the image used for the 'java-builder' container in the sample kubernetes plug-in PodTemplates provided with this image.  Otherwise, the image from the 'java:latest' ImageStreamTag in the 'openshift' namespace is used.

parameters.name: NODEJS_BUILDER_IMAGE
parameters.displayName: Image used for the 'nodejs' container of the sample 'nodejs-builder' PodTemplate
parameters.description: Setting this value overrides the image used for the 'nodejs-builder' container in the sample kubernetes plug-in PodTemplates provided with this image.  Otherwise, the image from the 'nodejs:latest' ImageStreamTag in the 'openshift' namespace is used.
